alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 8:45AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .An additional one quarter to one half inch of rainfall is expected this morning. This will keep water levels elevated on the Mark West, Santa Rosa and Laguna de Santa Rosa creeks. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until noon PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 AM PDT, Minor flooding on the Laguna de Santa Rosa, Mark West and Santa Rosa Creeks. - An additional one quarter to one half inch of rainfall is expected this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp and Forestville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
